bibl.title: Letter from Robert H. Kirk to Henry Rose Carter, February 26, 1917

div1.p: Kirk, on behalf of the Rockefeller Foundation, reimburses Carter for his expenses in 1916.

div1.head: Letter from Robert H. Kirk to Henry Rose Carter, February 26, 1917
div1.opener:
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR., CHAIRMAN BOARD OF TRUSTEES
EDWIN ROGERS EMBREE, SECRETARY
L. C. MYERS, TREASURER
ROBERT H. KIRK, COMPTROLLER
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
MEMBERS
WALLACE BUTTRICK
CHARLES W. ELIOT
SIMON FLEXNER
HARRY E. FOSDICK
FREDERICK T. GATES
A. BARTON HEPBURN
CHARLES E. HUGNES
HARRY PRATT JUDSON
STARR J. MURPHY
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
JULIUS ROSENWALD
MARTIN A. AYERSON
FREDERICK STRAUSS
GEORGE E. VINCENT
February 26, 1917.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
There is enclosed herewith the Foundation's check
No. 7912, dated February 24, 1917, to your order for:

$3,548.45 (Three thousand five hundred forty-
eight dollars and forty-five cents)
in payment of the balance due on your personal account in con-
nection with the Yellow Fever Commission for 1916.

Kindly sign, date, and return to us the corresponding
voucher No. 55281 also enclosed herewith.
div1.closer:
Very truly, Robert H. Kirk. Dr. H. R. Carter,
Treasury Department,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Md.
